description:
Randomly found this place as we were strolling down Castro. The happy hours menu definitely caught my attention. 

2 lemon drops for $7.50! Who can beat that? It has a pretty high alcohol content as well. 

It is pretty packed even at 5 pm on a Sunday. People were just enjoying each other's companies. Old MVs (like Britney Spears and Madonna) were playing on the TV. 

I love it! Definitely going to try to catch the happy hours again!
author: Yuan Z.

description:
I don't think you can beat Moby Dick's happy hour prices. $2 for draft beer? Ok! The bartender also makes a fantastic slightly dirty martini.

Behind the bar a giant fish tank offers a little something extra, and they have a pool table and 3 pinball machines in the back for a little friendly competition. Your classic dive bar - dark and old looking, as if nothing has changed since they first opened the doors. Overall a really fun environment and seemingly an institution in the neighborhood of Castro. As we were leaving they were setting up for a drag show.

Beware that you will not get phone service in this bar, at least not if you have Verizon like I do.
author: Bri T.

description:
I am so happy I found this place! The best thing about this bar is that they have the buy 1 get 1 free frozen margaritas! These margaritas are dangerous but delicious.... It can get crowded but everyone is very friendly!!

CASH ONLY
author: Mauricia L.

description: Nice enough place but I get the idea they are trying to be something they aren't.  Trying to compete with other bars isn't really working out. Moby attracts a very heavy drinking crowd of regulars. Why not just cater to that kind of crowd if that's who your customers are. Instead they have re-tread go-go boys and the absolute worst drag show in SF that has been grinding on for years. They might be trying to intentionally be bad in an ironic sort of way, if so no one is in on it. The bartenders are great especially the Colt calendar man in the daytime and the man at night Patrick. They almost know what you're drinking before you sit down. I don't know where they hire their bar backs but the one thundering though the last few times I was there seemed to be off his medication.
author: Joe B.

description:
Small, old style bar, cash only.

The 2-for-1 frozen margaritas for $7 are awesome!

There's 1 pool table and a few pinball machines in the back.

Wish they accepted credit cards here.
author: Wesley S.

description: I went to several bars all in the same night and this one was the worst one based on customer service. 2 stars deducted for the way the bartender made me feel. 1st one for when he found out I didn't have cash he grabbed the drinks and put them on the counter behind him--like a little kid just got toys taken away! So I waited for my friend to come back from the bathroom and he paid for the drinks. The 2nd star deducted for when I attempted to ask that same bartender for a second drink. I told the bartender that I wanted something similar to my first drink but just not the same one. His response was "when you make a decision then you let me know" and he turned his back on me just as quick as he did as when he took the drinks away during the first interaction. I did NOT buy another drink! He was the dick of Moby Dick.
author: Miguel O.

description: Why are they so rude?! Not cute. Some of us came to spend money and the bartender wad such a white a-hole.
author: Mario L.

description: I've come here many times. This one bartender not sure his name, but he is one of the older ones is rude. I consider myself quiet and nice and always tip above and beyond the norm. Well on this night he must have been frustrated and should have taken the night off. He was mean and rude. I have never been treated this way in life ever. I will not. I repeat NOT ever come to this establishment ever. I work hard for my money and will not spend it at a place where the bartenders have attitude and speak to me in a negative way. I'm sure it's not the bars fault, but this bartender put a bad taste in my mouth. #fail #rude #racist #badfortheestablishment #disappointmentforthecommunity
author: S J.

description:
Fun gay bar when you're with good company, glad our Yelpy friend Vincent L. joined us.  The bartender Patrick made a decent mojito.  At least he tried and went out of his way to find some mint, others don't even try.  Thanks to fellow Yelper Edwin R. for confirming what I thought I saw in the fish tank, and it wasn't my mind playing tricks on me (or the mojito) LOL!

'Til we meet again ~ cheers!!!

https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/moby-dick-san-francisco?select=7ejQeVMys1cfZ3U8rUdQhg
https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/moby-dick-san-francisco?select=euGJEhGgnjfnjSHPX3Sg-g
author: Christine R.

description: This is a brilliant bar in the Castro. On Tuesdays all draft beer is $2, and you can't get much better than this. Slightly more chilled vs others in the area, and bar staff are lovely. And sometimes there are Doritos if you sit at the bar...
author: Tom W.

description: Came to this establishment to watch drag race and Queen Dilly Dally's Variety Show-- also got to watch a hand job, made new friends and had very well priced drinks. I give this bar 5 stars for surprising me.
author: D Andrew P.

description: Good vibes Good music good location.    Lots of foot traffic came in and out while we were there
author: Alicia G.

description: I've been here probably a few times and I automatically sensed this older vibe to this place. Just a bunch of older daddies and their friends who hang around . I mean it's a good place if that's what you're looking for . The decor has a kind of vintage feel to it , and they have a back area to chill. It usually gets really crowded too so you have to stand by other people a bit uncomfortably . It's more a chill vibe compared to other places by the Castro .
author: Joshua O.

description:
A gay bar called Moby Dick? Ok, that's funny and awesome all at the same time. The place is pretty cool. It's a total hangout bar complete with a dingy dark bathroom and a pool table. I'm all about it!

The beautiful and beefy bartender John is awesome. It's just a simple place that has some character and a sense of humor. I really like the big fish tank behind the bar. That surely adds to the underwater theme. All in all Moby Dick is just good. 

Drink prices are very reasonable but keep in mind that it's CASH ONLY. There is an ATM onsite if one should need it. I like the simplicity of the space. It's a watering hole for sure. Good for shots, beers, drinks, or whatever your flavor might be. I'm a fan.
author: Richard R.

description:
$2 beer on Tuesday. That's on ALL the beers.

It's probably one of the best deals in town and they have a pretty decent selection of brews on tap. Less microbrews but perennial favorites from good old local staples like Anchor and Lagunitas to seasonal brews like Sam Adam's Cold Snap, they're all $2 on Tuesday. If you get in here right after work, you'll probably be able to find a quiet spot to catch up with friends over beers but it starts to fill up around 7pm. Friendly bartenders and generally chill crowd. 

In a neighborhood of buy one get one liquor drink happy hours, it's nice that folks aren't to messy here for brewskis happy hour. Not till later at least.
author: Jon L.

description:
I always love to stop by to this place, I remember the first time I came here was 2008 and I really
Enjoyed and I used to come here every other weekend now I don't come very often because isn't the same crowed of
People but when I do I really like the service and music, frozen
Margaritas and draught beer are my favorites, another plus is NO COVER ++
author: Fabricio V.

description: Cool nautical themed bar in the Castro. Pretty classy and not cheesy at all. Fun crowd, good drinks/beer, and you can play/watch pool or pinball machines. Definitely a fun place to go for a drink, conversation (music isn't too loud), no cover and it's not a club. I'd definitely come back.
author: Brett T.

description: Fun place.   They have pinball machines in the back of the house.   The drinks are extremely strong.  Two will set the scene for a fun night.  Will return again.
author: William G.

description: Very unpretentious neighborhoody joint with friendly bar tenders and a very mixed clientele. Pool table is always nice
author: Jim S.

description: This couldn't be a nicer or more friendly establishment. Kim and Patrick are the sweetest. They are attentive and wanting to please. The patrons are regulars and all so friendly. Whether you are with a group or solo I highly recommend popping in to one of the oldest bars in the heart of the Castro.
author: rosita t.

description:
After finishing a fantastic brunch and mimosas with my BFF at Café Flore, we decided to mosey on over to shoot some pool ...and where else... Moby DICK! 

Moby DICK was quite homey. I really liked their saltwater aquarium over looking the bar. Did I mention the bartenders here were a hunk of meat? For you guys or ladies who love your men with fur, tattoos and full of bulging bear muscles, this could very well be, your regular hangout.  My BFF goes bonkers over them!!

Their draft beer here is actually really good!  I would always recommend coming here on late Sunday afternoon if you like "Sex on the beach!"  Sunday happy hour draws quite a crowd. Also, Moby DICK has a pool table at back, and great fun to get together with friends. One thing that stood out from Moby DICK was how friendly everyone was, the bartender especially!

Just so you know, here are the pluses for coming to Moby DICK:
--local bar with lots of drink options
--friendly hunk bartenders
--friendly patrons
--great for late Sunday afternoon hangouts with friends and then some
--pool table located at back
--awesome saltwater aquarium (great to stare at after a few drinks)
--plenty of very friendly drag queens (they were fantastic, but watch the glitters as they get "grindy" if they land on your drinks)

Well, until then... Cheers! :p
author: Edwin R.

description: Great local bar.   And Tuesday's the beers were two bucks a pop!   Everyone was friendly and welcoming!
author: Sean M.

description: Had a great time. The happy hour specials were great, and the bar tenders were super nice. Got two beers, two lemon drop drinks, and two tequila shots, all for 22 bucks. One of the best deals in SF! A must go if you are in the Castro. Plus a cheap way to get lit!
author: Ross S.

description: Decent neighborhood bar with lots of room to spread out in the main street-level portion as well as the elevated game area in the back. The beer menu is decent, and mixed drinks are OK too. Would be worth another star if the clientele and staff here - like at many Castro bars - didn't respectively view non-white patrons who are standing in line as people to be pushed aside or ignored blatantly.
author: Vincent L.

description: I came here and got my cherry popped with some a big fat cock!!!!  Definitely recommend!! I will be back boys ;)
author: Steven O.

description:
I was walking through the Castro looking for a friendly neighborhood bar. I walked, and walked, then skipped to the door of Mobi Dick. The bartender was Chris and he was welcoming, informative, and very easy on the eye. He coached me through the drink specials in his black tank top which matched his black beard. Chris poured me a frozen margarita and it delighted me. I had four more then parted ways with my new, favorite bartender of the Castro. I hope to visit again soon. Thanks Mobi Dick. 

FYI - Cash Only.
author: William R.

description:
Came here with some friends because we made our way to Castro and wanted to just have a few drinks. We came in here and had some Jack and Coke's and vodka clubs. The drinks were relatively good, a bit watered down. They weren't expensive either if I remember correctly, pretty normal prices.

The bartender was nice and pretty quick. The people hanging out at the bar were pretty friendly as well. The area was clean and well lit. Music was playing, so it wasn't completely quiet in there. 

We came during the day (maybe noon?), it wasn't packed, around 5 other people in the bar besides us. They have a billiards table and a few pinball machines in the venue. We only played a few games of billiards, finished our drinks and were on our way. It wasn't that great of bar, but we came just for the experience.
author: Steven P.

description: ok
author: Sarah S.

description:
Come for the frozen margaritas, the friendly bartenders and the kickass aquarium. 

Unfortunately I can't call this my favorite bar in the Castro anymore because the music selection has, for the most part, gone considerably downhill  over the past 4 or 5 years (think generic, mass appealing EDM you might hear while at the gym), and it's so loud that you can't ignore it or have much of a conversation instead. If that's your jam, you'll feel at home.
author: Nicholas F.

description: Jack & coke so good, good entertainment with music videos playing on the tv. Plus pool table and pinball machines
author: Laurie M.

description: 2-for-1 margaritas! And the nicest darn bartenders for a casual mid-day drink and snack. It's pretty divey and smells strongly of beer but that's what makes it so homey.
author: Vivian H.

description:
The bartender here EXPECTED a tip no matter the quality of his service.  Sure he poured our drink and gave me change back...   And I was thinking about what tip to give.  Meanwhile the bartender tapped me on the arm indicating that he EXPECTED a tip. 

Naturally I took offense  A tip is given for good service.  Not because a bartender feels entitled.  So I didn't give him a tip because I thought he was VERY RUDE.

The bartender disagreed.  He pointed me out to the bouncer.  And had me kicked out because I didn't give him a tip.  To be fair he did ask me how much I spent and threw $10.50 at me (didn't cover what I spent )  and then had me kicked out. 

Won't be going back.  Tips are for good service.  Apparently that bartender feels otherwise.  He earns the name - moby DICK
author: Nick J.

description:
Gross. Just gross.
If you like sticky floors and tables, filthy walls, and mysterious, grimy substances smeared on your clothing and shoes, then do come to Moby Dick. Washing your hands after leaving is a must. In fact, a hot, scalding shower after visiting Moby Dick is probably a better idea. 

The patrons are raucous, out of control, freakish, and just made me feel uncomfortable. 

Their frozen cocktails are quite delicious, and they are BOGO on weekends. Besides that, though, I just can't find anything redeemable about this bar.
author: Gary R.

description: Friendly bar staff and a diverse clientele in an unassuming amazing setting. I enjoyed my drinks and had a great time watching people walking around. I also noticed that so many tourists visit this bar. The area is not as bad as people think. I felt really safe during the time I was there. I definitively had a wonderful time and will come back to grab a drink soon.
author: Danny G.

description:
Great drink specials during the day. But lousy pinball games. They're broken down and the flippers don't work. Moby Dick was one of the great places to play pinball, but not any more. 

Also, on Fridays there are a group of guys who bring their girlfriends and play pool. Really annoying
author: David H.

description: Cheap with good atmosphere and music. $2 beer on Tuesdays - best deal I've ever seen! Pool table is fun too.
author: Philipp A.

description:
After what seemed like an eternity, Friday was upon us again. Hooray! You know it's been a stressful week when the first thing you want after punching out for the day is a drink. 

This was my second stop of the night. My co-worker/ boss-in-training had just finished up work in the office and had time to kill before he was meeting with a personal trainer (which, by the way, reminds me of how badly I, myself, need a run on a treadmill). It's been a long, hard year for me, and my waistline has been a clear indicator. That being said, I was quite relieved when he ordered us a couple of vodka tonics as opposed to beer or a sugary cocktail. 

The atmosphere was very chill, but I imagine this place becoming very loud and packed during peak hours. If you need a quick beverage to quench your thirst, this would be a perfect pick.

Be warned: there is only one co-ed bathroom stall upstairs, and a men's room downstairs. If you are a lady, don't hold your bladder until the very last minute or you may end up with an embarrassing accident all over their clean floor. I have become quite adept at waiting my turn to use the facilities (one of the few things I learned in college). 

I love the fish tank above the bar. It's quite soothing to watch those little swimming beauties move around their serene waters. 

I also love that they have free wi-fi, and the password starts out with "gotdick".
author: Brandi W.

description:
I love the atmosphere here! 

The people are chill and no attitude, the drinks are well balanced and the service is efficient and sexy! What more could a girl want?!! 
The fish tank is awesome and so much nicer than zoning out on a TV! 
Did I mention the service is sexy???!!! ; )

And they are super involved in supporting the community...and NOTHING is sexier than that! 
Thanks for another good time Moby Dick! : )
author: Monet A.

description: very cool place - easy to relax and chill or have fun at night
author: Alice T.

description:
Gay Bar Pub Crawl, Part 3 

Ahh. Now this place seemed to click for me. Maybe because it managed to convey friendliness, even with the same amount of raucous revelers around me. Maybe because we were actually able to speak to each other without sacrificing our vocal cords. Or, maybe it's because I liked the double entendre of the word "Dick", and realizing the literary Moby Dick was a sperm whale. 

"Dick". "Sperm". Ha! At this point I was plastered, and this amused me greatly. Because when I am drunk, in the Castro, at midnight...I have the humor of a twelve-year-old. 

I still never read the actual book. So basically, if I ever hear "Moby Dick" in the future, to me it will always remind me that that was the bar in San Francisco where I inexplicably switched from vodka to beer. I swear to God, I got 5's on both my AP English Language, and English Literature exams back in the day. 

I am so cultured. 
 
4 Stars.
author: Nathan I.

description: I came to San Francisco with my friends and we decided to stop our last night at your bar... And I left SF with a really bad perception thanks to one of you bartenders that treat my friends like shit ( because they looked Latin) saying things like "you are disgusting people" because they don't tip him(and actually we were talking about how hot was him and how I was going to tip, I was next in line ;) ) even when he didn't know that I was in charge of the tips (for the night) he just decided to start being mean in front of me! Ha, never coming back, sorry that you still have people like that working on a tourist attractive gay area! You don't go to costumers and start treating like shit them because the don't tip and of course he doesn't deserve the tip ;)
author: Christian V.

description:
Nice PLACE TO END OR START THE NIGHT..NOT SURE WHAT THIS BAR'S "IDENTITY" IS IN TERMS OF BEING A SPORTS BAR, PUB OR WHAT BUT IT WAS A COOL LITTLE SPORT TO GRAB A DRINK. Free CHEX MIX!
 and 2 for 1 margaritas every day!-whoops cap lock!
author: Karen S.

description:
We used to call this place Maybe Dick.  You might find Dick, but maybe not!

The reason to come here is two fold.  

Patrick is #1.  He is the kindest soul and all around fun loving guy.  He has been here a few years and his presence behind the bar is amazing.  He is the perfect fit for this place.

#2, the frozen drinks.  They will kick your ass.  They used to serve frozen Sex on the Beach on Sunday's...now they rotate I believe.

The music is usually good here too.

This place has sentimental meaning to me.  15 years ago my now husband would come here after work to "shoot pool."  I would often times, back then, swing by to check on him as he was quite the whipper snapper.  This spot is known for pool and old school pinball machines.  Now they have naked pool and drink and draw!!  What?!?

This is an iconic Castro gay bar that will live on hopefully forever.  I just love Maybe Dick and hope you do too. 

PS, the first bathroom is cruisy and the upstairs is private.
author: James S.

description:
I fail when I walked in. I am a straight female...walking in with another straight female. This...is not a female-type bar. And I think less-so for lesbians. o.O BUT, I didn't feel unwelcome, which is nice.

Tuesday night, the bar still has a fair amount of customers. There's no significant seating at the bar, and I moved a chair to the other side...which promptly blocked the part of the bar intended to be clear. Bartender was nice, and said I should just move if it gets busy. I agree...then we see there's seats in the back. Huh.

Beers are $2 all night on Tuesdays! Yum...cheap! We went to the back, where you basically hop on a large wooden...deck thing? My language skills fail me. We sit and chat for a bit, and I people-watch.

In a bar filled with about...25-30 people, we were the only females. The crowd is obviously in the gay group, but varies. I saw business-types, older drinkers, yuppies, just a mix. 

I would probably come back for a quick drink on a slow night, but not on one of their busy nights unless I can magically become a gay male. =)
author: Lily W.

description: Seemed like a decent bar.  It was clean, had a friendly staff, and places to sit, entertainment options (pool), and live sports.  We were there in the middle of the day on a Sunday, but all in all it was a pretty neat place.
author: Brian B.

description: American horror story and a drag show?! Worth the $2 cover, and 2 for 1 frozen margaritas are pretty awesome too
author: Charlie H.

description: From out of town, stopped in randomly cause the rest of the bar scene seemed dead and there were a lot of people in here. The drink I ordered wasn't great and the bartender was rude. Got a stand off-ish vibe from a lot of people in the bar. Headed back to the good ol' big apple!
author: Lisa M.

description: $2 for any beers on Tuesday and a super sweet guy behind the bar. He gave us all kinds of helpful info. Marty is the best!!! We only are here 5 days but will be back!!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Went here with some friends after going to The Cafe' club.  Looks like they have specials on drinks every night.  My friends got an amazing blended 'sex on the beach.'  

Crowd was chill.  Saw some guys with their shirts off.  Pretty hot stuff going on.  But yeah nothing much else, just a nice local gay bar.
author: Michelle M.

description: The design is fantastic! The low blue light makes the place mysterious and more attractive! A great choice for drinks before clubbing in Castro. 5 stars for the name, which is genius!
author: Vanessa K.

description: Well, went her before dinner and during World Series and was awesome crowd. Great pints! Thanks guys.
author: Ryan K.

description:
Always a good time! I use to play pool there when I lived in the neighborhood.

Just went back tonight and boy have things changed. I like the look, bartenders were friendly.

Had a great time!
author: Dean C.

description: I showed up for $3 frozen margaritas. I stayed for the free drag show and poetic reading of Nicki Minaj's "Stupid Hoe." I had the best time of my life! When do you get to have bangin' margaritas, a free drag show, and intense poetic pop song readings?!!! Adventure here and you'll have a great time.
author: Gladys M.

description: Talk about a sausage fest! As a straight person who loves the Castro, it often becomes super clear that the neighborhood is not catering to you. Don't get me wrong, I love this neighborhood. Living a few miles away from this place, I really wanted to make it my "Cheers". A place I could go to for a beer several times a week to unwind after work and before going home, but as many times as I went, it never got that feel. Definitely a pick up spot, or at least it seemed like it. The ratio of men to women, straight or otherwise, is about 95 to 5 and sometimes that makes a difference. Still, I seem I tend to go every now and then.
author: Hannah B.

description: Awesome frozen margaritas (2 for 1) and always busy with pretty hot guys. Most busy on weekends and Sundays. A pool table in the back of the room too.
author: SFCAFOX S.

description:
Moby Dick, the Great White Whale! Since the bar is neither a Whale nor white, I instead will describe Moby Dick in terms of Herman Melville himself.  

Melville is not the best way to spend a Saturday night.  And neither is Moby Dick

Melville wrote one of the most famous lines in English literature: "Call Me Ishmael."  Moby Dick certain seems to be one of the most famous bars in the Castro.  And that's sort of how it goes here, friendly guys tossing out their names.

Melville likes to go on tangents and digressions about mutinies and naval history.  Moby Dick is just one of those digressions.  Wait, how did I get here?  Shoot, I need to get back to the plot.

Melville was a man's man.  He was no Jack London, but shit, who is?  The guys here aren't queens or muscle gods or club kids, but guy's guys. Have you seen the pool table?

Melville made famous good ol' Bartleby who preferred not to do things quite a lot.  Cue a patron at Moby Dick asking for my phone number.  "I'd prefer not to."

Meville wrote Billy Budd.  And come on, that fresh faced cutie was only $100 dollars from appearing on Sean Cody.

Melville like Moby Dick is probably good for you (they tend to have decent drink specials and strong pours), but usually the eyes crave something a little more exciting.
author: Jeremy G.

description: This is one of the best bars in the neighborhood, not only does it have a fun bar staff but the patrons are a great mix of age and no attitude. Love their frozen 2 for 1 selection. They have fun events, fundraisers, local softball teams (Go Seamen!) and a big fish tank with colorful fish, good for those moments when you don't want to stare at your phone. It's in the heart of the Castro and has a couple of great windows to see the people traffic.
author: Tony P.

description: This is my favorite bar in the Castro! You can actually have a conversation and be able to hear the people you are with! The staff is always helpful and pleasant and they have a healthy pour when it comes to a cocktail! The atmosphere is a great mix of people, and they are very civic minded and gave back so much to the community. A true Castro landmark, not to be missed!
author: Peter S.

description: My dad and I (both straight) stopped in the afternoon. It was clean the drinks were cheap and strong! I don't usually care for frozen drinks but their frozen margaritas were pretty good!! The bartender was superb- funny,quick and knowledgable. We'd definitely go back!!!
author: Sarah S.

description: my poor GerGer didn't like this place because he had too much time to observe things while i was talking away with my skating friend.  i loved the cheap drinks.  yes it's divey and dirty.  but the drinks were cheap!
author: Brian K.

description:
Sure, drinks are cheap but they are a bit watered down. Also, this is a cash only bar. I ended up with a short Seth Rogan look-alike who followed me around and to other bars. Creeeeepppy. 

I did like their fish tank, music and otherwise friendly regulars. 

We headed out after a drink or two realizing it wasn't going to get any better. This is probably going to be your first stop if you were to do a Castro bar crawl.
author: Min T.

description:
I've had a long time hankering to check out Moby Dick, I think it might be the name.  Anyway, last weekend my husband and our friend Jay had a little pub crawl down 18th street after brunch at Harvey's.  

I was so pleased that we stopped at Moby Dick.  The gentleman working the bar was so nice, and there were a couple of guys who appeared to be regulars at the bar who were fun and let me join in on their conversation.   I also made a new BFF with a dude who was getting ready for a costume party with the theme "things you ride," yes, let your imagination wander.  

They have a pool table, and two pinball machines, score!  I had the most delicious frozen sex on the beach, and on Sunday's they have 2 for 1 drinks!  So I have a ticket to go back and redeem my next frozeny goodness.

I didn't give the place 5 stars just because it's hard to rate a place for complete potential at 1pm on a Sunday.  But I imagine it's awesome at night.  :)
author: Margaret I.

description: Cash only here, which is kind of annoying. As an out of town guest this is a bit difficult cause I have to go find an ATM and can't start a tab. Also, rude service. My friend from out of town was visiting and tried to play a light joke with a busy employee and got a very rude response. Not likely to come back.
author: Kristina K.

description:
YES to the 2-for-1 frozen margaritas (even on a Friday)!!

Fun music videos to watch on the many screens. (I'm not a regular so they were all "new" to me!)

I wrote in Japanese on the pool sign-up chalkboard and no one erased it for a long, long time.

That video game machine is the only reason we stayed so long. Those horribly photoshopped nudie photo match games are much more challenging (right...) here than in the other bars.

Ooh, and a "Bram Stoker's Dracula" pinball machine in the back!
author: Matthew B.

description:
After writing my review, the owner of Moby Dick responded, in private email, from his owner verified yelp account,  in defense. I should note that in all my years of Yelping establishments, no owner of a business has ever responded in such a poor, unprofessional demeanor. Just goes to show that some people aren't really fit for business. Anyway, I visited Moby Dick last night and noticed one of the other purple stripped fish swimming while rubbing its underbelly on the gravel below, then floating on the top of the water half the night as if it was dead, and suddenly spazzing around in circles. Seems like someone needs to upgrade their filter and check the ammonia levels in the water.

Here are his responses:
Really do you really think we switched fish to fool people? The only time put new fish in the tank is when one dies, which is very rare. I'm sorry about the cover charge on Wednesday nights, but the bar does not receive any of the money from that. The performer charges that, and keeps that to pay the other performers. It is easy to get around that cover charge, just come in before they start to charge and you can stay and watch the show for free. There is only a cover on that one night,  we had a fundraiser the other night, that we asked for a donation, but it was up to you if you wanted to pay. Other than that we don't have events that we charge a cover for. When you write these things that are not correct, they not only affect the bar but the people that work there, I'm sorry if you had a bad experience and we strive to please everyone but sometimes it is impossible.  Joe Cappelletti  owner

My response:




19 hours ago

I haven't said anything that wasn't correct. The person whom was collecting cover was foolishly playing around in the street and suddenly came running to the door to collect a 10 cover. Not a donation. 

For someone that has been coming to this bar for years and suddenly see these changes, it's a bit disappointing. I understand a business must evolve so I don't fault you for that. I will stay away on these days.

You, on the other hand, seem to be defensive rather than listen to a customers comments. Just because you don't like what I say gives you no right to be defensive. 

Also, if you read carefully, I did say it is a great place to go aside from the cover and drag show drama. And the fish comment isn't accusing you of fooling customers. Having seen "henry" as I have called the fish for years not being there anymore, and replaced by a lookalike was a bit disappointing but not fault of yours. 

I will be posting your email and my response to the public review as I feel it's important that people see my review and your feedback

Thanks

And his last response: ( I haven't even read this nor do I plan on responding. no point, just wanted to throw this on here so everyone can see his character, spoken from his own words)

OK you too need to read my response , there is a definite cover charge on Wednesday nights not a donation. I said that we had a fundraiser and they asked for a donation not a cover charge on that night . I also said you could easily avoid the cover charge by coming before they start charging the cover and get in for free and watch the show for free if you wanted to. I think you should post both of those things your review and my response and this one if you like. I tried to tell you a way around the cover, and also to straighten out that we don't charge a cover for other events " other lame events. your words'. Which you implied in your review. As far as" Henry" is concerned,what was it you would have wanted me to do when replacing the fish? "I guess they thought the customers wouldn't be able tell..." again your words.. That seems like an unnecessary statement. If i seemed defensive I'm sorry but I don't like people making glib remarks that are not true and then telling me i have no right to do something. Post whatever you like.
author: A W.

description: Nice little bar on the corner of 18th/Hartford streets serving a beer and liquor until your hearts content.  The bartenders are happy guys who all seem to draw the same crowd and although most bars in the Castro are a little pretentious this place leaves it judgment at the door.  No where else in the neighborhood can you find a fish tank with a phallic presence within.  Plus you can get all the pear cider you want!
author: Kevin J.

description:
Out of all the Castro bars, this one is my favorite. It has a great 20-30 something mix of people and the bartenders are not douchebags. They tend to play funky 80's and 90's music, a popular pool table in the evenings and a few hard to find pinball games in the back.

Sunday's tend to be it's busiest day and it can get very crowded.
author: Terry C.

description:
Moby Dick's is a nice neighborhood bar.  I love that there is a lot of natural light, and they often play good music.  I often stop by to watch the Giant's games.  Today when I came by they only had soccer on and wouldn't put the Giants game on any of their many tv's.  I was told that soccer is better and since it's World Cup they wouldn't show the Giant's game.  I might be able to understand the logic if USA was playing today.

Personally I have a problem with that.  The Giants are our local team, most of the people watching soccer haven't seen a game in years...they're just fans during the World Cup.  

I'll be back to enjoy Moby Dick's, but they need to realize there are many in this neighborhood that do support their local teams.  I'll be going to the watering holes that I can count on the fact that they are playing our home team games.
author: John ..

description: Not exactly the novel, but the nautical theme goes all the way with penis-shaped coral and a nativity scene in the same exotic fish tank.
author: Peter C.

description: The best bar in the Castro.  You should definitely stop in for a drink.  Friendly bartenders and fish to look at.   And the clientele is very attractive and a great variety of all kinds of people.
author: Marshall B.

description:
I grew up in gay culture. My parents are both lesbians and I spend most of my 20s as an on/off again gay boy. I eventually found my place as a ladyboy and can go back to the culture. In some ways appreciating it more. In Moby Dick I saw many of the gay men my parents invited over.

I went to this bar during PRIDE. I walked into the bar and saw their was two other women there. This jock looking guy said as I walked by and looked at him, "There's another woman here". So I talked with him and his girlfriend. He thought I was very attractive, I guess with a lot of straight boys bone structure doesn't matter.

So as we were talking. This guy said to him, "I'll suck your ****" to which I replied, "Why don't you let me **** it?" and he said, "You're a woman" to which I replied, "Not really, still got the plumbing and not getting rid of it". I then ended up talking to him. We had an entertaining conversation, just discussing the gay scene and stuff.

But it's a fun bar. Most of the crowd here is 45+ and is the baby boomer gay crowd. If you're a twink or a clone, I'd avoid it unless you're looking for a daddy.

*cue discussions about Judy Garland, Carmen Miranda, and Marlena Deitrich*

That's the crowd. These are the classic gay men. You'll see your Christopher Lowells, Nathan Lanes, and Harvey Fiersteins here.
author: Lana P.

description: Great spot for casual drinks!  Just off the beaten path.  Paul the bartender cleans the aquarium in a jock - thats fun to watch
author: James V.

description: Witnessed one of the employees have some sort of mental breakdown here. Sure it was nearly closing, but he was screaming at the top of his lungs at his otherwise rather respectfully calm patrons to "get the hell out" and basically verbally attacking everyone 15 minutes prior to official closing. Then he kind of mumbled an apology to himself, something about "having a bad day", and then continued to scream again. Also had the worst mojito of my life.
author: Sandy B.

description:
This a late 90's style video bar with a giant fish tank that makes the whole place smell like a wet mop... or maybe they use old mops to clean the place - who knows. 
It good enough for their famous 2 for 1 margaritas - just keep in mind the price is the quality you get in your drinks.
author: Randy S.

description: A go to chill bar for warm days because it's shady and wind tunnely, they have odd ball music videos, and 2-for-1 frozen margaritas. Also they are one of the "dive" bars where a drink pour is strong but also not total balls! Take a lesson The Edge.
author: Luke M.

description:
I have been to Moby Dick many, many times since turning 21 and have always enjoyed myself until the bartender, Michael, ruined the experience.

My group, 3 straight ladies and one gay man, entered the bar to have a drink after spending a great afternoon at Dolores Part. My gay friend and I go up to buy drinks, no problem. The other two straight girls go up to purchase drinks and are asked about their sexual preference and told that as straight girls, they should purchase their next drink elsewhere. We all finished our drinks since they were paid for and then started to leave.

I did stop by the bar area to get the bartenders name (for my Yelp review) and he wouldn't even look at me. His colleague then asked was wrong and offered to serve us but we declined. He then asked what we wanted and I said "Nothing, unless he wants to apologize". His colleague apologized on his behalf and told us we could file a complaint with the bar (which I will) but the actual bartender who was rude never even turned around to look at us. 

His behavior was inappropriate and rude. I would never refuse service to someone based on whether they are gay, straight or whatever else. The gay community is such a welcoming community and then this guy acts like a total a-hole and ruined that bar in my eyes. 

I will never go there again, which should make Michael's day.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
-Friendly Staff
-Never a cover
-They serve me in glasses (when did it become acceptable to serve a drink in plastic?)
-Cheap drinks
-Love the salt water aquarium

-I wish they took credit cards. That's the only negative thing I have to say.
author: Keau K.

description:
Let's just say I leave "reasonably near" moby dick. I enjoy coming here early on a weekday before we head out on our evening. I would say it is rather crowded Fri-Sat night but Sunday seems to be the hottest night.  This is also a fav for the sporty gay softball guys.

I wish their bathrooms weren't so stinky I could smell them if I open one of our back windows. So for that I must take away a star.

The drinks are stiff and they've got a nice aquarium, a great happy hour, pinball, and pool... what more do you need? Oh! If it's Britney's new album, they've got that too!
author: Nikki M.

description:
Do you need to meet the below criteria?

- cheap day drinking
- non-cavelike ambiance with preferably large window to soak in gorgeous outdoor weather
-delicious drinks
-hot men (unattanability makes them all the more drool-worthy)

Look no further than Moby Dick.
author: Gabrielle J.

description: Visiting from Texas.  Wanted to be impressed.  Ordered a few rum and cokes.  They were, eh.  Interesting bathroom downstairs.   Bar has a big fish tank.  Sticky floors.....
author: Ryan L.

description: When I arrived to Moby Dick, this place was not busy.  There was plenty of places to sit down, play pool, or play pin ball.  The music was nice and I did not feel uncomfortable.
author: Carlene R.

description:
As a transssexual woman I feel pretty out of place at this bar.  Unless I am totally shitfaced then it is so-so.

So many gay guys...of course, obviously.  This bar has very few women.  If you are a young woman and want to go clubbing with the gay boys in the Castro I suggest to avoid this spot.

Everyone is nice....but this is the place for 30something gay men to hang with each other.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
Great happy hour and crowd. Doesin't get cheek to cheek crowded like some other bars.

Watch out for the red lit bathroom with the mirror over the urinal... I have some STORIES about that!
author: Kevin K.

description:
moby dick was weird. they had REALLY weird music videos, and mirrors for the place to look bigger than it really was.

our bartender was really nice, but i don't know if i'd come back here...  i'd recommend coming here if you want to see some eclectic, weird, disturbing music videos of bad music.

i was convinced they were recording them in their freezer at moby dick. i dont know. it was weird....
author: Ava M.

description: I used to like hanging out here when I was visiting. Won't be going back, bartenders are not friendly.
author: Keith P.

description:
Well, you know  - this is a cool place. The atmosphere is relaxed and you can chill here to good house music (when I visited) with videos. 

They also have an extraordinary aquarium!

The drawbacks are really the people - I haven't felt that welcomed (and neither have some of my friends) when I'm here. Maybe it's just not my crowd/scene? I don't know... I don't know what scene this would be called. It doesn't seem that specific, but somehow it's not mine.
author: Jason B.

description:
A terrific neighborhood bar.  Drinks are cheap and STRONG!  Staff is ridiculously friendly.  A large fish tank over the bar and great music and videos with multiple tvs.  In the back there is a pool table and pingball machine.  The mens room has mirrors on every wall and the ceiling, which might spook some guys out. I have found the clientele to be mostly locals and friendly.  On Monday nights they have a model in the back and patrons are encouraged to bring their paintbrushes, pencils, charcoal, or whatever you want to sketch him.  I have no idea why some believe it to be dirty; I have never experiecned that.  I have ALWAYS had a good time here - every time! 

Wish they accepted credit cards - alas, it is cash only!
author: SF G.

description: Excellent bloody marys, perfect spiciness! Friendly service. Great place to people watch. Not crowded on a Sunday afternoon.
author: Brook R.

description: I love how casual this place is, it's a nice place to just go grab a drink with out all the fuss. The 2-for-1 margaritas are fabulous just like all the other drinks which are poured strong but not too stong. I feel like I can't really comment on the crowd because there's really no typical type of crowd here that I've noticed.
author: Chris W.

description:
Awwwwkkward...

maybe cause I'm a straight female. 

But mostly because it's  boring and awkward.
author: simone H.

description:
Use to love this place so I am sad to be writing this review.  The next time you pour me a drink bartender, that tastes like floor cleaner, your taking it back.  Couldn't drink it.  Being a bartender doesn't mean just flooding a glass with cheap and awful liquor and a splash of mixer and serving it.  I mean I get why you did it.  That night looked like everyone got beat to death with an ugly stick upon entry, but come on!  You have to make drinks you yourself would actually drink.  Get rid of that Rum it is actually Mr Clean!

I use to love this place... A broken down frozen drink machine here means its off for the night I guess...
author: Joseph F.

description:
Moby Dick  is the business - a clean, straight-friendly gay bar with a sweet crowd.  The doorman  is swell the drinks are strong the prices are good. Great selection of music videos playing on giant screens. I kept popping up to twirl to the beat. No one cared.

 I admit to being sensitive to attitudes and there was zero.  Granted, it was around Halloween and I was sporting a Minnie Mouse costume with ears! Felt perfectly at home. We sat near the front door. Mainly gay, very straight friendly crowd. 

Very nice friendly folk.  I'd go there anytime with anyone I know, secure in our comfort and enjoyment. Hell, I'd even go there alone .... One of the co-owners, Scott, bought us a round just cause I told him I bussed some nearby glasses! Sweet.

PS 
If I were a gay man I'd go there to find a boyfriend, those men are hot as hell, fit, well dressed, good skin  ...
author: SF T.

description: The drinks are fine and cheap and the bartenders are nice. But at 1:45am my friends & I were thrown out very abruptly by a little bouncer with anger management issues, no apologies, even as we tried to explain we were only waiting for our friend to leave the bathroom. So, just beware of the angry little man if you're there at closing time.
author: Chris L.

description:
Love my gays and this bar! 

Seriously, it's like a gay cheers :) strong drinks, regular old creepy men at the bar, and local gays.! Loves it!!! but it defintely is a divey type bar, not a upper scale bar. 

side note : There is a section of the bar that is really out of place.. there are arcade games? wtf? weird......
author: Nina M.

description: A great place with great bartenders and a nice laid back atmosphere. It's amazing that the (very) attractive bartenders are so friendly! Most of the Castro bartenders have so much attitude! It's a refreshing change...
author: Lars L.

description:
Cheap drinks. No compulsion to dance.
Not a lot of obnoxious little kids running around.
Neighborhoodly.
Mellow.
...and one of my ex's avoids it like the plague.

Loves it.
author: Anthony B.

description:
OK so this is part of my on-going saga with my main gays, which has been re-invented by a recent break up.  Have you ever noticed how break ups cause you to make decisions like accepting an invitation to Moby Dick's on a Tuesday at 9:30 pm with your hairdresser and his hot boyfriend, who, by the way, have no real interest in you being there and are actually just inviting you bacause you are recently single and they are good loving friends?  Well.....this new compulsion has lead me to many a gay bar recently, and I've lived in the Castro for three years and never been to any of them before....

(don't worry, once I am feeling more *myself* I will begin hitting the Mission again with my cab light *on*) 

Hit this place last week, and while I wanted to despise it, I rather enjoy the name cause, well, like any red blooded female I love the pirates.  Which is weird, cause I've never met one, not do I suspect that I ever will, but am consumately sure they are HOT.  Sorry, I digress. 

Had a great time here!!? I know, I know, seemed bizarre cause it was filled with cruising gay men...but it was also filled with locals just looking for a chat and a friend, so while my hairdresser and his delectible BF made out in the corner after shots of Patron, I made friends with a guy named Beckett and we discussed Waiting for Godot, my favorite all time play, until I felt successfully gorgeoous again.  

Long story short: 

Don't judge a book by its cover

Don't forget that friends are to be found in the most unlikely of places 

Don't forget to shave and wear cute undies even when you go out in the Castro cause you never know.... ;) 

The End
author: Claire C.

description:
Moby Dick

*Smirk*

Oh you gays, you're just so precious.  I could put you in my pocket and take you home.  The boyfriend might have something to say about that, I don't think we're at the orgy-phase in our relationship - isn't that the 5th anniversary gift?  
I get so confused.  

Moby Dick.  It is a bar.  Pretty local.  Nothing particularly stand out, nothing particularly bad.  I felt youngish.  I'd probably come here for pre-drinking drinking if I lived in the 'hood.  But I don't, so I won't.

As an aside, I kind of wish straight bars were named similarly.
author: Mat K.

description: Moby Dick's 2 for 1 cold slushy Sex on the Beach special on Sundays is pretty hard to deny when you're passing through and a little parched. The vibe is laid back and the crowd is a little more mature (not necessarily older, but just less wild) than the few other Castro bars I've been to, though I'm sure it gets wild on weekend nights. The only time I've been here was on a warm and non-overcast summer afternoon, and the windows and doors were all open so the room was airy and cool, loud with chatter, all with a 90s and today pop music backdrop. LOVED IT.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
I've been here and it's cool, but frankly, I do not even need to come in, because their shit is out in the street: I was driving home not long ago at 2AM, and as I came up to the corner it sits on, I heard a crack like a gunshot.

A short, kidney-bean shaped woman probably in her sixties, wearing nothing but shoes, white socks, and a turquoise one-piece bathing suit, was administering discipline with a leather flail to some bent-over dude while other people watched.

Friendly place, but clearly you don't wanna get out of line with the clientele.
author: Karsten P.

description:
Well now Bambi has made the rounds in the Castro but doesn't really get to go to Moby Dick that much. You see this place is for the 9-5 crowd where everyone has to be tucked in bed by 10pm after excessive cruising and drinking  and Bambi usually doesn't get to the bottle until after 11pm on a good night. 

Moby Dick primarily has a 30 something clientele where the potential to score a long term mate is greater than a one night stand . Now I must confess I prefer the latter cause I treasure and guard my freedom like my life and let's be honest am not the marrying type (except for the lady in the black van with no windows).

That said the cocktails do flow here. The crowd shows it's age with out shame but with a little spark and overall a good time can be had with out expecting to get hitched or ditched. 

Avoid the weekends... it gets really packed.
author: Teddy d.

description: the happy hour is very happy. the service was fantastic. I will go back there again.i would give five stars if wasn't for the aquarian that i don't like.fish should be free not in box of water.
author: B H.

description:
After having a nice "ladies" lunch at SPQR, my friend and I decided we needed to have one drink in the Castro.  We had never been to Moby Dick's before, but they had a huge sign advertising Happy Hour, so we decided to check it out.
The bartender was very friendly and was not afraid to pour a stiff drink. We ended up having Long Island Ice Tea. You know the drink you have not ordered since you were 22?  At $4 a pop, they went down pretty easily. Thank god this place is cash only, as we ran out of money about the 5Th round! I had an early morning flight to Atlanta, so this really could have got ugly.
We also played a bit of pin ball and were just having a lot of fun. I can't really compare this to other bars in The Castro, but I thought this was one hell of a good time!! 
Thanks Di.  :o)
author: Lisa A.

description:
Going to this bar as a female I immediately stand out -- and then I turn into an invisible nothing  -- but then again this is how it feels to be a female in most bars in the Castro!  
I've sparked conversation with some great guys at this bar -- and have enjoyed some great drinks!  I found it a tad weird that they didn't make mojitos  -- I believed they said it was even too gay for them to serve -- however they were ok giving my friends and I a few orders of lemon drops??!  It's a fun bar and will continuing hanging out there!
author: Melanie R.

description:
3 things I really liked about this bar:

1) The music video selection, including "Soccer Practice with The Water Polo Team by Gay Pimp", which is among my favorite videos ever.
2) The ENORMOUS phallus in the fish tank
3) The fact that the bartender didn't mind when I got so flustered gaping at the enormous phallus in the fish tank that I forgot to pay for my beer.

Other than that, it's pretty average. Good place to go if you're a girl and want to drink without being hit on. While staring at an enormous phallus.
author: Liz G.

description:
Hot Sunday afternoon.

Gay boyfriend.

Mind-numbingly cold sex on the beach coming out of a tap.

With a cherry on top.

Bliss.
author: LeSLiE W.

description:
I went here with some friends for the first time and I had a great time. The drinks here were strong, which I like, and all the other bar patrons seemed very nice and relaxed.

I would avoid the bathroom though unless you really really have to go. They have a full length mirror in front of the trough so there is no way you can hide without any strangers seeing it.
author: Xavier G.

description: This was my first gay bar.  Since I'm a straight man from a very conservative town, I've never had the inkling to go, but now that I went, I started to think, how different and similar this is to other bars.  This bar was pretty fun and chill.  We went in, had a beer, hung out, watched some people try to get us to donate money to their softball team and drank some more.  I'd probably come back here if I was in the area since they make their mixed drinks stronger than other places I've been to.
author: George U.

description:
Sunday is the busiest day here and many of those there are not young.  Some
older guys, something like Twin Peaks saloon.
author: Richard D.

description:
They serve Vodka Sodas in a glass mug, need I say more. Actually I think they serve all the drinks in glass mugs! Went here last weekend with some friends, needed to get away for a minute from Alameda, so somehow I ended up at MD's. 

The place is fun and I think it's a great place to go with a group of friends and check out the local uhhum "scenery", it's SF so there's a lot to check out. Drinks are made well and the bar staff is pretty chill and friendly, don't you love it when a bartender hands you your drink with a smile? Right. 

One thing I would change is the front door. I swear that thing will either bruise someones hand or if you are the right height, may make you sterile. This door is heavy, has a top half and bottom half, and swings with a vengeance. So watch out. 

Next time you find yourself wandering around the area, hit em up for a drink.
author: Derrick E.

description:
This is the last place that I want to be in an earthquake... with the giant aquarium above the bar and all. 

That being said... this is one of my favorite places to be in SF the rest of the time. 

Growing up in Las Vegas, I was pretty sure that all bars had margaritas on tap at all times... and that they came frozen... thank goodness Moby's does not disappoint this view of the world for me... 

The drinks are strong, the men attractive, and the atmosphere lowkey (if worrysome in an earthquake).

Well worth the visit!
author: Jordan Y.

description:
Moby Dick is probably my favorite neighborhood Bar in The Castro.  The Bartenders are very nice and personable (both Johns and Patrick are the best).

The bar is clean, the drinks are not over priced, and there is pool and pinball.  The music is not too loud, making it a nice place to meet friends for conversation.  They are known for their 2-for-1 Frozen Margaritas.  They are offered at the 2-for-1 rate all the time, and are popular.

Unfortunately their happy hour doesn't include Call drinks, only Well drinks and a daily special.  It would be nice if they had a happy hour food.
author: Mike R.

description:
I like the place, the pool table, the cute older crowd.

Sometimes I feel out of place there, and I like that feeling too.

The music must be improved upon ASAP; except for The Vengaboys, keep 'em coming.

The drinks? Better than average.
author: Jorge C.

description:
What I like about Moby's is that it is less of a scene than the BOC or Badlands.  And, the crowd tends to be more mature.  And the maturity I am referring to has nothing to do with age.  Also, the drinks tend to be really good and are made by generally friendly bartenders.

What I don't like about Moby's is the trough.  Its so . . .  wrong.  And, on my last trip there were guys taking pictures on their cell phones.  And, that is beyond wrong.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Always have a great time @ Moby Dick's !~

Best bartenders - nice AND sexy!~  Music and overall vibe is a perfect match.
author: Michael M.

description:
It's not like this bar is fancy or unusual or anything special, but it tends to get packed on Sunday afternoons!  

Once, my drinking companion dropped a nearly full glass and just stared at it with puzzlement.  It was like he couldn't figure out how the glass he held in his slippery little hands ended up on the ground.  I swear it was nearly a minute later that he realized he should pick up the glass off the ground.  By that point, I was laughing and pointing at him.
author: Marcus C.

description:
As a woman, I appreciate the laid-back, chill but hip atmosphere of this bar.  Every time I'm in there, I meet really fun, talkative men and women!  

If you're a woman in the Castro, you can't say that about a lot of bars.

The bartenders are very sweet as well!
author: Moira W.

description:
I went here last nite with some friends for a game of pool. I dont play pool, this was only about the 4th time in my life.  Im getting better each time though! I can even hit the ball!  lol
This is a smallish bar, with one pool table  and pinball machines at the back.  When we got there, there was one group playing and we were able to mark outselves down as next in line... We didnt wait that long.  By the time we started playing, 9ish, more people came in, and there were 3 groups after us on the list.  So come in early if you want to play right away.  Girls and guys here, the music was some sort of quiet rock genre, and the volume wasnt too loud.  It was a cool place to hang out with friends, very different from the badlands type place scene.
author: Merredith L.

description:
I stumbled on Moby Dick first when my friend Zach introduced me to it.

Then it became something I'd stop by when I was on my Sunday booze cruise in the city.

"I'm getting sober, y'all... we need a drink special RIGHT NOW!"

It's a great bar in my opinion just because it knows what it's doing and is a fun time. It can really crowded on weekends but if you go there when nobody else is drinking - you should be game for a good and comfortable spot.

The men's bathroom is a bit odd and pervy, but that just adds all the magic to Moby Dick.

And he probably wouldn't have wanted it any other way...
author: Kim D.

description:
Jared F. and I went here for a game of pool and I had a blast. It's nice to actually go to a bar in the hood without the pretense, cute boys, and a pool table. I also really liked the underwater nativity scene, just wrong on so many levels. 
Great diversity of people and a great vibe. Highly recommend it.
author: Jason D.

description:
OK so I was expecting this place to be scary. BUT I LOOOOVED how it wasn't crowded unlike qbar-a place that makes you feel disgusting and sweaty and yuk.

MY cheap ass also LOVED the specials ($6 2-for-1 Margarita frozen drink every day except Sunday, god bless you) and the bartender for entertaining my drunk questions. I think my friends loved the retro junk playing on the vidscreens last night too.

 YAY
author: Jason S.

description: OK OK Brian G. called me out on my review, which rightfully needs an update. Prior to earlier this year, I had never been to Moby Dick's on a weeknight, which is essentially where it's really at. The crowd is minimal, the drink specials are rockin' and the atmosphere is totally chill. I myself like to play or watch others play pool. You meet some rad folks. So my sage advice would dictate coming here on weeknights but avoiding it like the plague on weekend nights.
author: Natalye R.

description:
This place is unbearable, you won't quite fancy it.  The bartenders are mean and ugly, the drinks are over-priced and weaky-tweaky, it's muggy and full of scary older men.  Just trust me, you'll without doubt hate it. 

All right I lied abt everything, however do stay away anyway.  I hate it when it gets crowded. (wry laugh)
author: Jesada P.

description: i sent an email to the owner and still not heard back. horrible way to run your business
author: Matthew F.

description:
This is a great place to get a drink eith friends, but what I do not like is the lack of racial diversity. I have been in that place so many time and have been the spot in the room.

If you are into White boys then this is the place to go. If you like boys of all races, then go elsewhere.
author: Robert Shawn W.

description:
I feel like you're not a true San Francisco fag hag until you have been to Moby Dick with said homo friend. I was one out of three women there. 

Tonight I had a great time. Pretty good music with great eye candy (that you can't have because...well...they don't go for the vag damnit). Definitely for the early 30's plus crowd. 

It was fun talking to the men about their next day Folsom Street Fair get-ups.

Nice and strong margaritas. I was good to go after one.
author: Ileana H.

description:
I'm willing to bet money that I was the only straight girl in this bar today.

And I'm more than willing to bet money that I have never been felt up at a bar as much as I was at this bar today.

On top of that, I don't even have to bet money on the fact that I've never gotten (is that a word?) as drunk during daylight hours as I got at this bar today.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
I'm not a guy. I'm not gay. I'm not a gay guy.
But dang, I had a lot of fun here! Even ran into people I knew. The video was funny (Jackass) and the music was good. :)
author: dj z.

description:
I like this place!! I'm usually one of the only women in the entire place and the men want absolutely nothing to do with me! They will be friendly and share their space, unlike at the 440 club on Castro (!!!) but usually only when I initiate it. 
Otherwise, the pinball is great! Addam's Family is my favorite, but watch out for the one of the far left, it tends to jam.
author: ariana t.

description: I needed a stiff one--and since I heard this bar makes a strong drink, I head on over to Castro.  Comfortable, if not imaginative bar and seating.  Goth-like music videos.  Friendly, pleasant, easily distracted bartender.
author: Poet D.

description: I couldn't tell if it stank because of the fish tank behind the bar or the clientele, but either way I left my beer on the counter and paddled for shore!
author: Andrew G.

description:
I couln't taste the diet in my jack.  I was in heaven.  Wandered in alone and wound up bar hoppin with three new friends.  I know one of them wanted to trick.  Silly gays.

This is one of my favorite bars and I have only been here 3 times.  There is plenty of space and decent music that you can have a conversation over without screaming.  It's super casual, which is a minus for me, but it seems like everywhere in SF is super casual.  I'm not in Scottsdale any more toto.
author: Ian M.

description: There are a lot of bars in the hood, but I do usually end up either here or the Mix.  It is certainly a scene in here but it has a good vibe and I like it, especially to bring friends from out of town.  They have a tongue in cheek name, pinball and pool, and trough bathrooms, what else can you ask for from a Castro bar?  OH the best thing is that during Xmas they put a nativity set in the awesome fishtank... and the bartender pointed out the baby Jesus is missing its head. I nearly spit out my drink laughing. I'd say it is rather clique-ish here, so I'd bring friends.
author: Aaron W.

description:
I love this place!
I am a total convert. I used to dislike this place quite alot, but my friends just kept dragging me back. Now, If I'm in the Castro, I'm probably there at some point. Good drinks, VERY laid back atmosphere and great mix of people. Young/Old, Ethnicities of all sorts, Pool players/Pinball players. Big thumbs up. Also, the cheapest place to get your drunk on in the Castro with the 2 for 1 frozen margaritas. Yumm. :)
author: Jamie M.

description:
today was my 21st bday (woohooo).and yes, i do love some friendly neighborhood bars just because i feel inclusive, somehow. anyways, i celebrated my legality here...with some white russian and a singapore sling. funny that the bartender and other drinkers (this was during happy hour..around 3ish)...they have a little clue about singapore sling, that the bartender had to look at the recipe. i'm all for that since i don't care..and it's nice that he's trying to make me a sling, even though i also suggested if he could just make me a cosmo, if he failed to do so. 

anyways, the bartender did and i was happy! overall, experience wasn't disappointing..maybe if i go there when there's more people then it's on and poppin. i don't care if i mingle with old men.. which is moby dick's majority patrons. YAY.
author: Marc K.

description:
Every time I go to Moby Dick, I have a really good time. I rang in '07 there and had a lot of fun.

The music is so-so -- not eardrum-meltingly bad like, say, Badlands. It's just a bit cheesy sometimes. The crowd is usually fun, though, and consists of guys of all sorts/ages, usually leaning toward the scruffy side (which is FINE by me).

And the drinks BURN.
author: The Other Jeff A.

description:
Chill laid back bar in the Castro. Definately low key and relaxed compared to the other bars in the neighborhood. A good place to go to play some pool or pinball and have a beer or drink. I wouls say it is 95% male but there have been women there every time I have been there which is not something I could say for all castro bars.

As for it being a "sausage fest" ...everyone likes a brautwurst now and then right?
author: Brian M.

description: The daytime bartender was really nice. Good draft beer selection, gross bathrooms. Still fun.
author: Sabbies B.

description: Me and a group of girls went in here Saturday night not realizing it was a gay bar - we just heard good music and say some great looking men so we walked right in!  Decided to stay anyway once we realized the vibe - ordered drinks, the bartender was friendly enough, made conversation and laughed with us.  We were obviousley out of place, but none the less we were not uncomfortable enjoying ourselves here.  The place was clean, drinks were reasonably prices and plenty strong.  I won't be going back, it's not my sort of place, but if it's what you are into then give it a shot!
author: Nichole G.

description:
See my review of The Sausage Factory Italian Restaurant and Pizzeria.

[Thanks for looking out, Cyn.]
author: Matthew R.

description:
Strong drinks, Strong men, I'm in.  I've had to wait and it gets crowed but I always like 2 remind people who complain about this; you live in a crowded city and you are out on a Sat night when all the out-of-towners are up, so why are you suprised?

It's where twinks go to grow up when they get hair on their chest.
author: Cristian M.

description:
The four stars are for context... I usually don't like the Castro because of the meat market filled with horrible music. I like good music (snob) and Moby Dick's every three or four songs will play a good track that fills me with joy, only to be brought down by crappy American pop. I've heard them play some Cure songs, New Order, and I think the Smith's once... Duran Duran too!

I do like the atmosphere of just a regular bar, which Moby Dick is, not too many frills other than a pool table and some pinball machines. No special or flashing colored lights, rounded metal fixtures, or plastic anything. The crowed is a bit older, but it's surely because experience has shown them that the other places in the Castro aren't so hot.

Oh, I think the bartender who use to have a fairly long mustache and beard, but now trimmed down, is hot. And yes, they do have a trough with a mirror over it and no, it does not bother me ;)
author: Robert P.

description:
I want to go, where everybody knows your name.  And you're always glad you came!

Walking through the double doors at Moby's is like stepping into a community of friendly faces and good times.  THIS is the epitome of a "neighborhood bar."  The staff are superbly friendly and are pretty heavy handed when it comes to pouring a nice Sapphire and soda with a lemon twist.  Mostly known for their 2 for 1 Sex on the Beach slushies, they are also known for the four pinball machines and pool table that is never covered.

The right side of the establishment is lined with benches from the moment you walk in, and continues up the stairs to the very rear.  Two or three fans keep the air flowing as best as they can overhead, while three screens keep you entertained with brilliant colors if the guy you came on a date with is boring.  Take a gander into the fish tank and do not be mistaken...that coral does look rather phallic.  :OP

It can become extremely crowded here Friday and Saturday nights, some come prepared and don't wear flip flops.  Typically people begin their evenings here and venture off to other venues later in the night.

Cheers!
author: Shane P.

description: This bar was my oasis when I first moved to the neighborhood/City four years ago.  It's just around the corner from my house, which makes it one of my favorite places to mosey on down from my street.  It was a place to come home to after a day of studying, grab a drink and play a round (or twelve) of pinball.  The bartenders are always nice, always tending to everyone and not the good-looking ones first, and it's truly one of the gem bars that has yet to revamp itself with the LA look of new establishments coming into the neighborhood.  There is always a resident artist monthly, one of the best happy-hours in the neighborhood (because of the good-looking after work crowds) and a place to find locals on the weekends too.
author: Boho H.

description:
Even my non-drinkin' pardner in crime likes to come to Moby's to check out the nice looking dudes "our age" and younger.  Nice place to chat up the straight chicks who love this joint to have love-gossip sessions with their queer man-pals.

All-in-all a reasonably good place to get a buzz on before headin' for more cruisy shores.

I particularly like the place on a sunny afternoon when the half door is open next to the pool table.  The sun comes in, the breeze is fine and my martini is made just how I asked the hunky bartender to shake it.
author: Curtdude T.

description:
reminded me of a middle school dance: it seemed like a bunch of people were just standing around, waiting for someone to talk to them. 

maybe i came on a bad night?
author: Jamie C.

description: Ended up here somehow. The drinks were reasonably priced, but then again, it was happy hour and they were having twofers. It wasn't crowded, however, the only place to sit other than the six stools at the bar were these strangely high benches up against the wall. I kinda felt like I was sitting on a cliff desperately hanging onto my gin and tonic for dear life. Other than that, the people were nice and unobtrusive, and the place wasn't too loud and obnoxious. Oh, one more thing: if you have to pee, hold it until you get to the nearest gas station. the men's room there is dark, seedy, there's a nasty pee-trough and no toilet, and you can barely see what you're doing. I think when it gets busy on the weekends, people there have sex or something. Gross.
author: Boo M.

description: This is actually a great bar - not so much a "sodomy on the high seas" vibe as much as a "pet store specializing in fish but selling alcohol" sort of feeling about it.  I (finally) figured out whence the name: look for the sculpture in the aquarium.
author: Mokirobinson M.

description: The two stars are for  when my girl friend and I went before here before knitting classes for cocktails.  There was no one there and it was comfortable.  Then again we could have been anywhere.  The weekend is another story.  This place is just too crowded and noisy.  It is impossible to have a conversation there and the way it's set up you spend the evening being pushed around and spilled on.
author: Sean O.

description: Ok, so I have been back and loved the place.  Of course, the bartender I had was really nice and made some really strong vodka cran's.  It was not too crowded the night I went and my friends and I had a good time.  I think I just went on a bad night the first time but had a really great time the last time I went.  The music was good and all the bartenders were really cool.  Its was almost like I was in a completely different place.  Thanks for the good drinks and smiles.
author: Adam B.

description: It was described as a sausage fest and a pickup place by a straight woman, whose perception of the place is decidely different from most of her gay brethren. I find this to be a bar where people go when they're tired of the dull, dreary cruise scene and just want to kick back and relax in a non-threatening or oppressive atmosphere. Pool, pinball, and conversation with a friendly neighborhood crowd. Call me Ishmael.
author: Gourmet G.

description: I love the names of bars in the Castro, Moby Dick is probably my favorite. I've gone here a couple of times for drinks and it is such a pick-up scene, but pretty friendly for happy hour.
author: Nish N.

description: Pretty much the only gay bar in the Castro I actually enjoy going too. The music isn't really the best, but the crowd more than makes up for it. Usually filled with down to earth fellas who are more about just being guys rather than guys who are trying to fit into a scene.
author: Geoff W.

description: So there is a group of Castro boys - lots of product in the hair, waay too much time staring at themselves in the mirror - think of themselves as 'the cool kids' and fit better in L.A.   These boys are NOT at Moby Dick's.  THANK GOD.  Its like an oasis of genuine cool.  I love the attitude here - meaning, there is NONE.  Guys are great and friendly.  Drinks are solid.  Watching pool is awesome.  The fish tank is brilliant.  One of my favorite things about the Castro.  So glad Moby's is here.
author: Dann H.

description: this is one of my favorite bars to hit on a saturday night.  the boys that go here are right up my alley - and a little less pretentious than some other bars in the hood.  The nautical theme is kind of fun...just not another generic gay bar.
author: Nick G.

description: For what it is, it's pretty damn good.  I don't think it's a pick up place or "sausage fest" at all.  We went and had some beers, played pool with some older guys who seemed nice and weren't trying to get in our pants, and then tried our luck with pinball.  If you want to relax in the stro without the nelly queens and britney, head to Moby Dicks for a chill atmosphere, a good selection of beers, and a good'ol laid back time.
author: Jared F.

description: This place is a straight woman's heaven! Cheap drinks, friendly people, good music, clean bathrooms with no line :) For stopping by to check out the place with friends on a short vacations trip...this place is good in my books! Did I mention cheap drinks!
author: Cindy B.

description: Unfortunately the Theatre of Magic pinball machine is gone, so I don't have any reason to come back here. It's too bad because it is a decent, clean bar otherwise. They still have 3 pinball machines left, but none I was interested in.
author: greg g.

description: I'm not a bar person, per se. But I do enjoy going here because Moby Dick isn't so scene/meat market-y, like so many of the other bars in the Castro. Very nice little neighborhood joint, no pressure. I brought my sis and her bf here, and they felt just fine (albeit he did freak out a bit regarding the special restroom set up). ;-)
author: Ryan T.

description: Friendly staff and tight quarters make for a decent SF gay bar experience. However,  when this place gets packed (and it does), it gets really packed. I've frequently seen many a drink spilled here, so be ready for fight the mostly guppy, and oddly tall crowd. If you wanna cruise the FiDi scene in the Castro, this is your spot.
author: Aaron L.

description:
I was in San Francisco for my birthday last week and went to the Castro District with some friends.  We stopped in Moby Dick bar for a drink. 
The atmosphere at Moby Dick is great.  Service was friendly and the Bloody Mary's were excellent.  There is something for everyone, TV to watch sports, video games and pinball machines.    
When in the area definitely stop in.
author: Peggy G.

description: definitely not like other bars in Castro. If you like to dance the night away with a bunch of sweaty, hot, shirtless gay men then don't come here. If you want a chill atmosphere to drink and actually be able to hear your friends, then do come here. I went here on St. Patty's day and it was so chill and comfortable. the bartender was super nice and they had very decent drink prices. The ladies room is amazing, probably because it is on of the few places in Castro that actually has a ladies room, not unisex dirty bathrooms.  a bit of an older crowd, but also a less annoying crowd. I would go back any day!
author: valeria b.

description: Just cause it's a gay bar doesn't mean the happy hour isn't hetero friendly. 2 for 1 magaritas and 3 dollar beers get the night started off right.
author: Andy L.

description: I decided to bring a long lost friend of mine here who leads a quiet life in the south.  I thought this this bar would be the perfect mix of unpretentious, and not too clubby.  I was hoping for him to have a great experience in the Castro, but instead we got the cold shoulder.  Hmph.  Our drinks were great, service was quick, and the bar itself is great.  The clientele seemed pushy, literally.  We finally left because we got tired of being plowed into.
author: Lauren M.

description: Surprised to see my best friend Natalye S. two star review of this place.  This is my favorite early evening/late afternoon bar in the Castro!  Fucking margarita machine and free pool on Mon/Tues during happy hour.  Cheap strong drinks.  Yay for the Castro!!
author: Brian G.
